node.title: She Plays a Young Serena Williams
node.alt: Demi Singleton got her acting start on Broadway, performing in “School of Rock.”
node.description: Demi Singleton stars in “King Richard,” opposite Will Smith.
node.content: ["Name: Demi Singleton", "Age: 14", "Hometown: New York City", "Currently Lives: In a Spanish-style house in Los Angeles with her parents and two siblings.", "Claim to Fame: Ms. Singleton is an actress, singer, dancer and cellist who plays a young Serena Williams in \u201cKing Richard,\u201d alongside Will Smith, who plays her father, Richard Williams.", "She started dancing at age 3, singing at age 7 and soon booked roles on Broadway. \u201cKing Richard\u201d is her big-screen debut. \u201cI just felt so loved and taken care of the entire time,\u201d she said. She developed a sisterly bond with Saniyya Sidney, who plays Venus Williams. \u201cWe were on the phone with each other all day yesterday. We\u2019re really like siblings now.\u201d", "Big Break: Ms. Singleton started pursuing acting professionally at age 10, after seeing \u201cMatilda\u201d on Broadway. \u201cI was able to see a bunch of young people doing what they love, and having so much fun on stage,\u201d she said. \u201cThat\u2019s what made me realize that I wanted to be an actress.\u201d", "She booked \u201cSchool of Rock\u201d on Broadway shortly after signing with her first agency, and next played Young Nala in \u201cThe Lion King.\u201d \u201cIt was hard in some ways, but it really wasn\u2019t like work,\u201d she said. \u201cBeing on Broadway is just fun, you just have an enjoyable time on stage.\u201d", "Latest Project: For \u201cKing Richard,\u201d which opened in theaters and HBO Max on Nov. 19, Ms. Singleton studied Serena Williams\u2019s mannerisms, but nothing prepared her more than meeting the Williams sisters on set. \u201cWe had a very long conversation about their teenage dating lives,\u201d she said. \u201cIt was really cool to get to see them from a different perspective, and see them talking about something other than what they\u2019re famous for.\u201d", "Next Thing: Ms. Singleton is hoping to release music within the next year, which she describes as a mix of pop and R&B. \u201cThe whole message of everything that I\u2019m releasing is equality and love and kindness,\u201d she said, \u201cbecause we\u2019re in such a weird time right now.\u201d", "Learning Curve: Ms. Singleton had never played tennis before \u201cKing Richard.\u201d She took three lessons before her final audition, because the casting directors wanted to see her and Ms. Sidney hit some balls together. \u201cI was learning to play like a literal icon,\u201d she said. \u201cI had to mimic her. If I were to go play right now, I wouldn\u2019t know how to play like anyone else but Serena Williams.\u201d"]
